Toni Collette and Drew Barrymore star as best friends in Miss You Already October 1, 2015 4:07pm Image Toni Collette on shaving head for the fifth time 4:13 
Toni Collette and Drew Barrymore play best friends in Miss You Already, but both had challenges to face during filming October 1st 2015 Email a friend 
WHILE most women wouldn’t dream of shaving their head, Toni Collette has done it five times. 
But none has meant more to her that her latest bald appearance, playing Milly, a mother-of-two fighting breast cancer in her new film Miss You Already. 
Collette stars alongside Drew Barrymore in the film which the pair say is more about love and friendship than the heartbreak of cancer. 
“This was the fifth,” Collette said of shaving her head. “I find it quite cleansing, but in terms of Miss You Already, it was something Milly went through and it was the least I could do, really I would have done anything for this film. I just love the story so much and I think it’s very special and very realistic and relatable and I just didn’t want to fake any of it.” Drew Barrymore and Toni Collette in October 2014. Source: Supplied 
It’s been a while since Collette had long locks. 
“After our film, I had another film so I had to keep it short for a couple of months. I mean it grows like a wig, really I’m very ...” 
“Hairy?” offered her co-star Drew Barrymore, as they both erupted in laughter. 
You can tell the pair’s off screen chemistry is as strong as it is on screen. 
Drew says this is testament to the pair’s relationship and the strength of the script. 
“You hope especially for something like this to do it justice that you have that electric connection and we got lucky and we did. We just plugged right in and that was it. Toni Collette and Drew Barrymore in Sydney to promote their film Miss You Already. Source: News Corp Australia 
“Our kids became friends, our husbands became friends and it all just interconnected. 
Added Collette: “It’s not often that you do a movie and come away with a really solid pal, but our characters are thick as thieves and they go through so much and Drew as an actress, and a person is so open and grounded and warm, we had that and we liked each other and it was inevitable.” 
Miss You Already opens in cinemas next Thursday. Jess (Drew Barrymore) and Milly (Toni Collette) in a scene from Miss You Already. Source: News Corp Australia
